info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:13AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Broome, west central Delaware, northeastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through NOON EDT... At 1113 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of thunderstorms over Susquehanna, or 13 miles northeast of Montrose, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Sanford, Susquehanna, Deposit, Susquehanna Depot, Hallstead, Windsor, New Milford, Great Bend and Lanesboro. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 79 and 84. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 223 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
